translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter with Sereyya

analyzed: nisajja pāsāda vare  vipassim addasam jina
translated: Sitting in the best of palaces,🔽I saw the Victorious One, Vipassī,
The All-Seeing One, who removes suffering.
The Leader of the World was going;
Like the one with a hundred spokes.
Through that confidence in my mind,
I do not recall any bad destination,
This is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
I have done what the Buddha asked.”🔽Thus the elder Gandhodakīya recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā gandhodakiyo thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Gandhodakiyattherassāpadānaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā gandhodakiyaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽gandhodakiya therassa apadānam catuttha
translated: The Elder Gandhodakīya’s Birth Story is the fourth.
